UPDATE_UNABLE_TO_APPLY_NOTIFY.description: Update: count of systems that cannot apply updates (timer initiated)

UPDATE_CANNOT_STAGE_EXTERNAL.description: Update: count of systems that cannot stage updates (externally initiated)

UPDATE_CANNOT_STAGE_NOTIFY.description: Update: count of systems that cannot stage updates (timer initiated)

UPDATE_PREF_UPDATE_CANCELATIONS_EXTERNAL.description: Update: number of sequential update elevation request cancelations greater than 0 (externally initiated)

UPDATE_PREF_UPDATE_CANCELATIONS_NOTIFY.description: Update: number of sequential update elevation request cancelations greater than 0 (timer initiated)

UPDATE_PREF_SERVICE_ERRORS_EXTERNAL.description: Update: number of sequential update service errors greater than 0 (externally initiated)

UPDATE_PREF_SERVICE_ERRORS_NOTIFY.description: Update: number of sequential update service errors greater than 0 (timer initiated)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_AUTO_EXTERNAL.description: Update: count of when the app.update.auto boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_AUTO_NOTIFY.description: Update: count of when the app.update.auto boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_ENABLED_EXTERNAL.description: Update: count of when the app.update.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_ENABLED_NOTIFY.description: Update: count of when the app.update.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_STAGING_ENABLED_E.description: Update: count of when the app.update.staging.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_STAGING_ENABLED_N.description: Update: count of when the app.update.staging.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_SERVICE_ENABLED_E.description: Update: count of when the app.update.service.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_NOT_PREF_UPDATE_SERVICE_ENABLED_N.description: Update: count of when the app.update.service.enabled boolean preference is not the default value of true (true values are not submitted)

UPDATE_DOWNLOAD_CODE_COMPLETE.description: Update: complete patch download result code

UPDATE_DOWNLOAD_CODE_PARTIAL.description: Update: complete patch download result code

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_COMPLETE_STARTUP.description: Update: the state of a complete update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_PARTIAL_STARTUP.description: Update: the state of a partial patch update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_UNKNOWN_STARTUP.description: Update: the state of an unknown patch update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_COMPLETE_STAGE.description: Update: the state of a complete patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_PARTIAL_STAGE.description: Update: the state of a partial patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_STATE_CODE_UNKNOWN_STAGE.description: Update: the state of an unknown patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_COMPLETE_STARTU.description: Update: the status error code for a failed complete patch update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_PARTIAL_STARTUP.description: Update: the status error code for a failed partial patch update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_UNKNOWN_STARTUP.description: Update: the status error code for a failed unknown patch update from update.status on startup

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_COMPLETE_STAGE.description: Update: the status error code for a failed complete patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_PARTIAL_STAGE.description: Update: the status error code for a failed partial patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_STATUS_ERROR_CODE_UNKNOWN_STAGE.description: Update: the status error code for a failed unknown patch update from update.status after staging

UPDATE_WIZ_LAST_PAGE_CODE.description: Update: the update wizard page displayed when the UI was closed (mapped in toolkit/mozapps/update/UpdateTelemetry.jsm)

THUNDERBIRD_CONVERSATIONS_TIME_TO_2ND_GL.description: Conversations: time between the moment we click and the second gloda query returns (ms)

FX_GESTURE_INSTALL_SNAPSHOT_OF_PAGE.description: Firefox: Time taken to store the image capture of the page to a canvas, for reuse while swiping through history (ms).

FX_GESTURE_COMPRESS_SNAPSHOT_OF_PAGE.description: Firefox: Time taken to kick off image compression of the canvas that will be used during swiping through history (ms).

FX_TAB_ANIM_OPEN_PREVIEW_FRAME_INTERVAL_.description: Average frame interval during tab open animation of about:newtab (preview=on), when other tabs are unaffected

FX_TAB_ANIM_OPEN_FRAME_INTERVAL_MS.description: Average frame interval during tab open animation of about:newtab (preview=off), when other tabs are unaffected

FX_TAB_ANIM_ANY_FRAME_INTERVAL_MS.description: Average frame interval during any tab open/close animation (excluding tabstrip scroll)

FX_REFRESH_DRIVER_CHROME_FRAME_DELAY_MS.description: Delay in ms between the target and the actual handling time of the frame at refresh driver in the chrome process.

FX_REFRESH_DRIVER_CONTENT_FRAME_DELAY_MS.description: Delay in ms between the target and the actual handling time of the frame at refresh driver in the content process.

FX_REFRESH_DRIVER_SYNC_SCROLL_FRAME_DELA.description: Delay in ms between the target and the actual handling time of the frame at refresh driver while scrolling synchronously.

FX_TAB_SWITCH_UPDATE_MS.description: Firefox: Time in ms spent updating UI in response to a tab switch

FX_TAB_SWITCH_TOTAL_MS.description: Firefox: Time in ms till a tab switch is complete including the first paint

FX_TAB_SWITCH_TOTAL_E10S_MS.description: Firefox: Time in ms between tab selection and tab content paint.

FX_TAB_SWITCH_SPINNER_VISIBLE_MS.description: Firefox: If the spinner interstitial displays during tab switching, records the time in ms the graphic is visible

FX_TAB_SWITCH_SPINNER_VISIBLE_LONG_MS.description: Firefox: If the spinner interstitial displays during tab switching, records the time in ms the graphic is visible. This probe is similar to FX_TAB_SWITCH_SPINNER_VISIBLE_MS, but is for truly degenerate cases.

FX_TAB_CLICK_MS.description: Firefox: Time in ms spent on switching tabs in response to a tab click

FX_BOOKMARKS_TOOLBAR_INIT_MS.description: Firefox: Time to initialize the bookmarks toolbar view (ms)

FX_BROWSER_FULLSCREEN_USED.description: The number of times that a session enters browser fullscreen (f11-fullscreen)

FX_NEW_WINDOW_MS.description: Firefox: Time taken to open a new browser window (ms)

FX_PAGE_LOAD_MS.description: Firefox: Time taken to load a page (ms). This includes all static contents, no dynamic content. Loading of about: pages is not counted.

FX_TOTAL_TOP_VISITS.description: Count the number of times a new top page was starting to load

FX_THUMBNAILS_CAPTURE_TIME_MS.description: THUMBNAILS: Time (ms) it takes to capture a thumbnail

FX_THUMBNAILS_STORE_TIME_MS.description: THUMBNAILS: Time (ms) it takes to store a thumbnail in the cache

FX_MIGRATION_ENTRY_POINT.description: Where the migration wizard was entered from. 0=Other/catch-all, 1=first-run, 2=refresh-firefox, 3=Places window, 4=Password manager

FX_MIGRATION_SOURCE_BROWSER.description: The browser that data is pulled from. The values correspond to the internal browser ID (see MigrationUtils.jsm)

FX_MIGRATION_ERRORS.description: Errors encountered during migration in buckets defined by the datatype, keyed by the string description of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_USAGE.description: Usage of migration for each datatype when migration is run through the post-firstrun flow which allows individual datatypes, keyed by the string description of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_IMPORTED_HOMEPAGE.description: Whether the homepage was imported during browser migration. Only available on release builds during firstrun.

FX_MIGRATION_BOOKMARKS_IMPORT_MS.description: How long it took to import bookmarks from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_HISTORY_IMPORT_MS.description: How long it took to import history from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_IMPORT_MS.description: How long it took to import logins (passwords) from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_BOOKMARKS_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing bookmarks from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably.

FX_MIGRATION_HISTORY_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing history from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably.

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing logins / passwords from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably.

FX_MIGRATION_BOOKMARKS_QUANTITY.description: How many bookmarks we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_HISTORY_QUANTITY.description: How many history visits we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_QUANTITY.description: How many logins (passwords) we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_BROWSER_COUNT.description: Number of browsers from which the user could migrate on initial profile migration. Only available on release builds during firstrun.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_EXISTING_DEFAULT_BR.description: The browser that was the default on the initial profile migration. The values correspond to the internal browser ID (see MigrationUtils.jsm)

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_AUTOMATED_IMPORT_PR.description: Where automatic migration was attempted, indicates to what degree we succeeded. Values 0-25 indicate progress through the automatic migration sequence, with 25 indicating the migration finished. 26 is only used when the migration produced errors before it finished.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_AUTOMATED_IMPORT_UN.description: Where undo of the automatic migration was attempted, indicates to what degree we succeeded to undo. 0 means we started to undo, 5 means we bailed out from the undo because it was not possible to complete it (there was nothing to undo or the user was signed in to sync). All higher values indicate progression through the undo sequence, with 30 indicating we finished the undo without exceptions in the middle.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_REASON.description: Why the undo functionality of an automatic migration was disabled: 0 means we used undo, 1 means the user signed in to sync, 2 means the user created/modified a password, 3 means the user created/modified a bookmark (item or folder), 4 means we showed an undo option repeatedly and the user did not use it, 5 means we showed an undo option and the user actively elected to keep the data. The whole thing is keyed to the identifiers of different browsers (so 'chrome', 'ie', 'edge', 'safari', etc.).

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_OFFERED.description: Indicates we showed a 'would you like to undo this automatic migration?' notification bar. The bucket indicates which nth day we're on (1st/2nd/3rd, by default - 0 would be indicative the pref didn't get set which shouldn't happen). After 3 days on which the notification gets shown, it will get disabled and never shown again.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_BOOKMARKS_ERRO.description: Indicates how many errors we find when trying to 'undo' bookmarks import. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_LOGINS_ERRORCO.description: Indicates how many errors we find when trying to 'undo' login (password) import. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_VISITS_ERRORCO.description: Indicates how many errors we find when trying to 'undo' history import. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_BOOKMARKS_MS.description: Indicates how long it took to undo the startup import of bookmarks, in ms. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_LOGINS_MS.description: Indicates how long it took to undo the startup import of logins, in ms. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_VISITS_MS.description: Indicates how long it took to undo the startup import of visits (history), in ms. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_UNDO_TOTAL_MS.description: Indicates how long it took to undo the entirety of the startup undo, in ms. Keys are internal ids of browsers we import from, e.g. 'chrome' or 'ie', etc.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_DATA_RECENCY.description: The 'last modified' time of the data we imported on the initial profile migration (time delta with 'now' at the time of migration, in hours). Collected for all browsers for which migration data is available, and stored keyed by browser identifier (e.g. 'ie', 'edge', 'safari', etc.).

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_USED_RECENT_BROWSER.description: Whether the browser we migrated from was the browser with the most recent data. Keyed by that browser's identifier (e.g. 'ie', 'edge', 'safari', etc.).

FX_STARTUP_EXTERNAL_CONTENT_HANDLER.description: Count how often the browser is opened as an external app handler. This is generally used when the browser is set as the default browser.

FX_PREFERENCES_CATEGORY_OPENED.description: Count how often each preference category is opened.

INPUT_EVENT_RESPONSE_MS.description: Time (ms) from the Input event being created to the end of it being handled

LOAD_INPUT_EVENT_RESPONSE_MS.description: Time (ms) from the Input event being created to the end of it being handled for events handling during page load only

EVENTLOOP_UI_ACTIVITY_EXP_MS.description: Widget: Time it takes for the message before a UI message (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_STARTUP_INIT_SESSION_.description: Session restore: Time it takes to prepare the data structures for restoring a session (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_STARTUP_ONLOAD_INITIA.description: Session restore: Time it takes to finish restoration once we have first opened a window (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_COLLECT_ALL_WINDOWS_D.description: Session restore: Time to collect all window data (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_COLLECT_COOKIES_MS.description: Session restore: Time to collect cookies (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_COLLECT_DATA_MS.description: Session restore: Time to collect all window and tab data (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_COLLECT_DATA_LONGEST_.description: Session restore: Duration of the longest uninterruptible operation while collecting all window and tab data (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_CONTENT_COLLECT_DATA_.description: Session restore: Duration of the longest uninterruptible operation while collecting data in the content process (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_SERIALIZE_DATA_MS.description: Session restore: Time to JSON serialize session data (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_READ_FILE_MS.description: Session restore: Time to read the session data from the file on disk (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_WRITE_FILE_MS.description: Session restore: Time to write the session data to the file on disk (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_FILE_SIZE_BYTES.description: Session restore: The size of file sessionstore.js (bytes)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_CORRUPT_FILE.description: Session restore: Whether the file read on startup contained parse-able JSON

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_ALL_FILES_CORRUPT.description: Session restore: Whether none of the backup files contained parse-able JSON

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_RESTORE_WINDOW_MS.description: Session restore: Time spent blocking the main thread while restoring a window state (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_SEND_UPDATE_CAUSED_OO.description: Count of messages sent by SessionRestore from child frames to the parent and that cannot be transmitted as they eat up too much memory.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_DOM_STORAGE_SIZE_ESTI.description: Session restore: Number of characters in DOM Storage for a tab. Pages without DOM Storage or with an empty DOM Storage are ignored.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_AUTO_RESTORE_DURATION.description: Session restore: If the browser is setup to auto-restore tabs, this probe measures the time elapsed between the instant we start Session Restore and the instant we have finished restoring tabs eagerly. At this stage, the tabs that are restored on demand are not restored yet.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_MANUAL_RESTORE_DURATI.description: Session restore: If a session is restored by the user clicking on 'Restore Session', this probe measures the time elapsed between the instant the user has clicked and the instant we have finished restoring tabs eagerly. At this stage, the tabs that are restored on demand are not restored yet.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_TABS_RESTOR.description: Session restore: Number of tabs in the session that has just been restored.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_WINDOWS_RES.description: Session restore: Number of windows in the session that has just been restored.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_EAGER_TABS_.description: Session restore: Number of tabs restored eagerly in the session that has just been restored.

FX_TABLETMODE_PAGE_LOAD.description: Number of toplevel location changes in tablet and desktop mode (only used on win10 where tablet mode is available)

FX_TOUCH_USED.description: Windows only. Counts occurrences of touch events

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_INDEX.description: Firefox: The index of the selected result in the URL bar popup

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_TYPE.description: Firefox: The type of the selected result in the URL bar popup. See nsBrowserGlue.js::_handleURLBarTelemetry for the result types.

INNERWINDOWS_WITH_MUTATION_LISTENERS.description: Deleted or to-be-reused innerwindow which has had mutation event listeners.

CHARSET_OVERRIDE_SITUATION.description: Labeling status of top-level page when overriding charset (0: unlabeled file URL without detection, 1: unlabeled non-TLD-guessed non-file URL without detection, 2: unlabeled file URL with detection, 3: unlabeled non-file URL with detection, 4: labeled, 5: already overridden, 6: bug, 7: unlabeled with TLD guessing)

CHARSET_OVERRIDE_USED.description: Whether the character encoding menu was used to override an encoding in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_ISO2022JP.description: Whether the decoder for ISO-2022-JP has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_IBM866.description: Whether the decoder for IBM866 has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACGREEK.description: Whether the decoder for MACGREEK has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACICELANDIC.description: Whether the decoder for MACICELANDIC has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACCE.description: Whether the decoder for MACCE has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACHEBREW.description: Whether the decoder for MACHEBREW has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACARABIC.description: Whether the decoder for MACARABIC has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACFARSI.description: Whether the decoder for MACFARSI has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACCROATIAN.description: Whether the decoder for MACCROATIAN has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACCYRILLIC.description: Whether the decoder for MACCYRILLIC has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACROMANIAN.description: Whether the decoder for MACROMANIAN has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACTURKISH.description: Whether the decoder for MACTURKISH has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACDEVANAGARI.description: Whether the decoder for MACDEVANAGARI has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACGUJARATI.description: Whether the decoder for MACGUJARATI has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_MACGURMUKHI.description: Whether the decoder for MACGURMUKHI has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_KOI8R.description: Whether the decoder for KOI8R has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_KOI8U.description: Whether the decoder for KOI8U has been instantiated in this session.

DECODER_INSTANTIATED_ISO_8859_5.description: Whether the decoder for ISO-8859-5 has been instantiated in this session.

LONG_REFLOW_INTERRUPTIBLE.description: Long running reflow, interruptible or not

XMLHTTPREQUEST_ASYNC_OR_SYNC.description: Type of XMLHttpRequest, async or sync

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SHUTDOWN_DATABASE_MS.description: Time to flush and close the localStorage database (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_PRELOAD_PENDING_ON_FIRST.description: True when we had to wait for a pending preload on first access to localStorage data, false otherwise

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETALLKEYS_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a list of all keys in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETKEY_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a key name in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETLENGTH_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return number of keys in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETVALUE_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a value for a key in LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SETVALUE_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we set a single key's value in LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_REMOVEKEY_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we remove a single key from LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_CLEAR_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we clear LocalStorage for all domains (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_UNLOAD_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to fetch LocalStorage data before we can clean the cache (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SESSIONONLY_PRELOAD_BLOC.description: Time to fetch LocalStorage data before we can expose them as session only data (ms)

RANGE_CHECKSUM_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with range checksum errors

BUCKET_ORDER_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with bucket order errors

TOTAL_COUNT_HIGH_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with total count high errors

TOTAL_COUNT_LOW_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with total count low errors

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORIES_COUNT.description: Number of directories in the archive at scan

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_OLDEST_DIRECTORY_AGE.description: The age of the oldest Telemetry archive directory in months

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SCAN_PING_COUNT.description: Number of Telemetry pings in the archive at scan

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SESSION_PING_COUNT.description: Number of Telemetry pings added to the archive during the session

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SIZE_MB.description: The size of the Telemetry archive (MB)

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTED_OVER_QUOTA.description: Number of Telemetry pings evicted from the archive during cleanup, because they were over the quota

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTED_OLD_DIRS.description: Number of Telemetry directories evicted from the archive during cleanup, because they were too old

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTING_DIRS_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting old directories

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_CHECKING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for checking if the archive is over-quota

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting over-quota pings

TELEMETRY_PENDING_LOAD_FAILURE_READ.description: Number of pending Telemetry pings that failed to load from the disk

TELEMETRY_PENDING_LOAD_FAILURE_PARSE.description: Number of pending Telemetry pings that failed to parse once loaded from the disk

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_SIZE_MB.description: The size of the Telemetry pending pings directory (MB). The special value 17 is used to indicate over quota pings.

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_AGE.description: The age, in days, of the pending pings.

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_EVICTED_OVER_QUO.description: Number of Telemetry pings evicted from the pending pings directory during cleanup, because they were over the quota

TELEMETRY_PENDING_EVICTING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting over-quota pending pings

TELEMETRY_PENDING_CHECKING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for checking if the pending pings are over-quota

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_SEND.description: Number of Telemetry pings discarded before sending because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_PENDING.description: Number of Telemetry pending pings discarded because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_ARCHIVED.description: Number of archived Telemetry pings discarded because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SUBMISSION_WAITING_CLIENT.description: The number of pings that were submitted and had to wait for a client id (i.e. before it was cached or loaded from disk)

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_PENDING_PINGS_SIZE_M.description: The size (MB) of the Telemetry pending pings exceeding the maximum file size

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_ARCHIVED_PINGS_SIZE_.description: The size (MB) of the Telemetry archived, compressed, pings exceeding the maximum file size

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_SEND_PINGS_SIZE_MB.description: The size (MB) of the ping data submitted to Telemetry exceeding the maximum size

TELEMETRY_COMPRESS.description: Time taken to compress telemetry object (ms)

TELEMETRY_SEND_SUCCESS.description: Time needed (in ms) for a successful send of a Telemetry ping to the servers and getting a reply back.

TELEMETRY_SEND_FAILURE.description: Time needed (in ms) for a failed send of a Telemetry ping to the servers and getting a reply back.

TELEMETRY_INVALID_PING_TYPE_SUBMITTED.description: Count of individual invalid ping types that were submitted to Telemetry.

TELEMETRY_INVALID_PAYLOAD_SUBMITTED.description: Count of individual invalid payloads that were submitted to Telemetry.

TELEMETRY_PING_EVICTED_FOR_SERVER_ERRORS.description: Number of Telemetry ping files evicted due to server errors (4XX HTTP code received)

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_LOAD.description: Set if Telemetry failed to load the session data from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_PARSE.description: Set if Telemetry failed to parse the session data loaded from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_VALIDATION.description: Set if Telemetry failed to validate the session data loaded from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_SAVE.description: Set if Telemetry failed to save the session data to disk.

TELEMETRY_SCHEDULER_TICK_EXCEPTION.description: Count of exceptions during executing the TelemetrySession scheduler tick logic.

TELEMETRY_SCHEDULER_WAKEUP.description: Count of TelemetrySession scheduler ticks that were delayed long enough to suspect sleep.

TELEMETRY_SCHEDULER_SEND_DAILY.description: Count of TelemetrySession triggering a daily ping.

TELEMETRY_TEST_FLAG.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_COUNT.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_COUNT2.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_COUNT_INIT_NO_RECORD.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched - initially not recording

TELEMETRY_TEST_CATEGORICAL.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_CATEGORICAL_OPTOUT.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_COUNT_INIT_NO_RECOR.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched - initially not recording

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_FLAG.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_COUNT.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_BOOLEAN.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_RELEASE_OPTOUT.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_RELEASE_OPTIN.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_RELEASE_OPTIN.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_KEYED_RELEASE_OPTOUT.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_EXPONENTIAL.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_LINEAR.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TELEMETRY_TEST_BOOLEAN.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

STARTUP_CRASH_DETECTED.description: Whether there was a crash during the last startup

SAFE_MODE_USAGE.description: Whether the user is in safe mode (No, Yes, Forced)

SCRIPT_BLOCK_INCORRECT_MIME.description: Whether the script load has a MIME type of ...?  (0=unknown, 1=js, 2=image, 3=audio, 4=video, 5=text/plain, 6=text/csv, 7=text/xml, 8=application/octet-stream, 9=application/xml, 10=text/html, 11=empty)

XCTO_NOSNIFF_BLOCK_IMAGE.description: Whether XCTO: nosniff would allow/block an image load? (0=allow, 1=block)

NEWTAB_PAGE_ENHANCED.description: New tab page is enhanced (showing suggestions).

NEWTAB_PAGE_LIFE_SPAN.description: Life-span of a new tab without suggested tile: time delta between first-visible and unload events (half-seconds).

NEWTAB_PAGE_LIFE_SPAN_SUGGESTED.description: Life-span of a new tab with suggested tile: time delta between first-visible and unload events (half-seconds).

NEWTAB_PAGE_PINNED_SITES_COUNT.description: Number of pinned sites on the new tab page.

NEWTAB_PAGE_BLOCKED_SITES_COUNT.description: Number of sites blocked from the new tab page.

NEWTAB_PAGE_SHOWN.description: Number of times about:newtab was shown from opening a new tab or window. *** No longer needed (bug 1156565). Delete histogram and accumulation code! ***

NEWTAB_PAGE_SITE_CLICKED.description: Track click count on about:newtab tiles per index (0-8). For non-default row or column configurations all clicks into the '9' bucket. *** No longer needed (bug 1156565). Delete histogram and accumulation code! ***

BROWSERPROVIDER_XUL_IMPORT_BOOKMARKS.description: Number of bookmarks in the original XUL places database

FENNEC_GLOBALHISTORY_ADD_MS.description: Time for a record to be added to history (ms)

FENNEC_GLOBALHISTORY_UPDATE_MS.description: Time for a record to be updated in history (ms)

FENNEC_GLOBALHISTORY_VISITED_BUILD_MS.description: Time to update the visited link set (ms)

FENNEC_RESTORING_ACTIVITY.description: Fennec is starting up but the Gecko thread was still running

FENNEC_SEARCH_LOADER_TIME_MS.description: Time for a URL bar DB search to return (ms)

FENNEC_STARTUP_TIME_GECKOREADY.description: Time for the Gecko:Ready message to arrive (ms)

FENNEC_STARTUP_TIME_JAVAUI.description: Time for the Java UI to load (ms)

FENNEC_TOPSITES_LOADER_TIME_MS.description: Time for the home screen Top Sites query to return with no filter set (ms)

FENNEC_ACTIVITY_STREAM_TOPSITES_LOADER_T.description: Time for the Activity Stream home screen Top Sites query to return (ms)

FENNEC_HOMEPANELS_CUSTOM.description: Whether the user has customized their homepanels

FENNEC_WAS_KILLED.description: Killed, likely due to an OOM condition

IPC_TRANSACTION_CANCEL.description: True when an IPC transaction is canceled

IPC_SAME_PROCESS_MESSAGE_COPY_OOM_KB.description: Whenever the same-process MessageManager cannot be sent through sendAsyncMessage as it would cause an OOM, the size of the message content, in kb.

SLOW_ADDON_WARNING_STATES.description: The states the Slow Add-on Warning goes through. 0: Displayed the warning. 1: User clicked on 'Disable add-on'. 2: User clicked 'Ignore add-on for now'. 3: User clicked 'Ignore add-on permanently'. 4: User closed notification. Other values are reserved for future uses.

SLOW_ADDON_WARNING_RESPONSE_TIME.description: Time elapsed between before responding to Slow Add-on Warning UI (ms). Not updated if the user doesn't respond at all.

SEARCH_COUNTS.description: Record the search counts for search engines

SEARCH_RESET_RESULT.description: Result of showing the search reset prompt to the user. 0=restored original default, 1=kept current engine, 2=changed engine, 3=closed the page, 4=opened search settings

SEARCH_SERVICE_INIT_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to initialize the search service

SEARCH_SERVICE_INIT_SYNC.description: search service has been initialized synchronously

SEARCH_SERVICE_ENGINE_COUNT.description: Recorded once per session near startup: records the search plugin count, including both built-in plugins (including the ones the user has hidden) and user-installed plugins.

SEARCH_SERVICE_HAS_UPDATES.description: Recorded once per session near startup: records true/false whether the search service has engines with update URLs.

SEARCH_SERVICE_HAS_ICON_UPDATES.description: Recorded once per session near startup: records true/false whether the search service has engines with icon update URLs.

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_FETCH_TIME_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to fetch the country code

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_FETCH_RESULT.description: Result of XHR request fetching the country-code. 0=SUCCESS, 1=SUCCESS_WITHOUT_DATA, 2=XHRTIMEOUT, 3=ERROR (rest reserved for finer-grained error codes later)

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_TIMEOUT.description: True if we stopped waiting for the XHR response before it completed

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_FETCH_CAUSED_SYNC.description: True if the search service was synchronously initialized while we were waiting for the XHR response

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_TIM.description: Set if the fetched country-code indicates US but the time-zone heuristic doesn't

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_TIMEZONE_MISMATCHED_CO.description: Set if the time-zone heuristic indicates US but the fetched country code doesn't

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_PLA.description: If we are on OSX and either the OSX countryCode or the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both do or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_NONUS_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_.description: If we are on OSX and neither the OSX countryCode nor the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both agree on the value or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_PLA.description: If we are on Windows and either the Windows countryCode or the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both do or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_NONUS_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_.description: If we are on Windows and neither the Windows countryCode nor the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both agree on the value or true otherwise

SOCIAL_ENABLED_ON_SESSION.description: Social has been enabled at least once on the current session

ENABLE_PRIVILEGE_EVER_CALLED.description: Whether enablePrivilege has ever been called during the current session

SUBJECT_PRINCIPAL_ACCESSED_WITHOUT_SCRIP.description: Whether the subject principal was accessed without script on the stack during the current session

COMPONENTS_SHIM_ACCESSED_BY_CONTENT.description: Whether content ever accesed the Components shim in this session

CHECK_ADDONS_MODIFIED_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to figure out extension last modified time

TELEMETRY_MEMORY_REPORTER_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to run memory reporters when sending a telemetry ping

SSL_SUCCESFUL_CERT_VALIDATION_TIME_MOZIL.description: Time spent on a successful cert verification in mozilla::pkix mode (ms)

SSL_INITIAL_FAILED_CERT_VALIDATION_TIME_.description: Time spent on an initially failed cert verification in mozilla::pkix mode (ms)

CRASH_STORE_COMPRESSED_BYTES.description: Size (in bytes) of the compressed crash store JSON file.

PDF_VIEWER_USED.description: How many times PDF Viewer was used

PDF_VIEWER_FALLBACK_SHOWN.description: How many times PDF Viewer fallback bar was shown

PDF_VIEWER_PRINT.description: How many times PDF Viewer print functionality was used

PDF_VIEWER_FONT_TYPES.description: The PDF document font types used

PDF_VIEWER_EMBED.description: A PDF document was embedded: true using OBJECT/EMBED and false using IFRAME

PDF_VIEWER_FORM.description: A PDF form expected: true for AcroForm and false for XFA

PDF_VIEWER_STREAM_TYPES.description: The PDF document compression stream types used

PDF_VIEWER_TIME_TO_VIEW_MS.description: Time spent to display first page in PDF Viewer (ms)

PLUGINS_NOTIFICATION_SHOWN.description: The number of times the click-to-activate notification was shown: false: shown by in-content activation true: shown by location bar activation

PLUGINS_NOTIFICATION_PLUGIN_COUNT.description: The number of plugins present in the click-to-activate notification, minus one (1, 2, 3, 4, more than 4)

PLUGINS_NOTIFICATION_USER_ACTION.description: User actions taken in the plugin notification: 0: allownow 1: allowalways 2: block

PLUGINS_INFOBAR_SHOWN.description: Count of when the hidden-plugin infobar was displayed.

PLUGINS_INFOBAR_BLOCK.description: Count the number of times the user clicked 'block' on the hidden-plugin infobar.

PLUGINS_INFOBAR_ALLOW.description: Count the number of times the user clicked 'allow' on the hidden-plugin infobar.

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_STATS.description: (Bug 1207089) Usage of popup notifications, keyed by ID (0 = Offered, 1..4 = Action, 5 = Click outside, 6 = Leave page, 7 = Use 'X', 8 = Not now, 10 = Open submenu, 11 = Learn more. Add 20 if happened after reopen.)

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_MAIN_ACTION_MS.description: (Bug 1207089) Time in ms between initially requesting a popup notification and triggering the main action, keyed by ID

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_DISMISSAL_MS.description: (Bug 1207089) Time in ms between displaying a popup notification and dismissing it without an action the first time, keyed by ID

PRINT_PREVIEW_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the browser enters print preview.

PRINT_PREVIEW_SIMPLIFY_PAGE_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the browser enters simplified mode on print preview.

PRINT_PREVIEW_SIMPLIFY_PAGE_UNAVAILABLE_.description: A counter incremented every time the simplified mode is unavailable on print preview.

PRINT_DIALOG_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the user opens print dialog.

PRINT_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the user prints a document.

DEVTOOLS_DEBUGGER_DISPLAY_SOURCE_LOCAL_M.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to display a selected source to the user.

DEVTOOLS_DEBUGGER_DISPLAY_SOURCE_REMOTE_.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to display a selected source to the user.

MEDIA_RUST_MP4PARSE_SUCCESS.description: (Bug 1220885) Whether the rust mp4 demuxer successfully parsed a stream segment.

MEDIA_RUST_MP4PARSE_ERROR_CODE.description: The error code reported when an MP4 parse attempt has failed.0 = OK, 1 = bad argument, 2 = invalid data, 3 = unsupported, 4 = unexpected end of file, 5 = read error.

MEDIA_RUST_MP4PARSE_TRACK_MATCH_AUDIO.description: Whether rust and stagefight mp4 parser audio track results match.

MEDIA_RUST_MP4PARSE_TRACK_MATCH_VIDEO.description: Whether rust and stagefight mp4 parser video track results match.

MEDIA_WMF_DECODE_ERROR.description: WMF media decoder error or success (0) codes.

MEDIA_OGG_LOADED_IS_CHAINED.description: Whether Ogg audio/video encountered are chained or not.

MEDIA_HLS_CANPLAY_REQUESTED.description: Reports a true value when a page requests canPlayType for an HTTP Live Streaming media type (or generic m3u playlist).

MEDIA_HLS_DECODER_SUCCESS.description: Reports whether a decoder for an HTTP Live Streaming media type was created when requested.

MEDIA_DECODING_PROCESS_CRASH.description: Records a value each time Fennec remote decoding process crashes unexpected while decoding media content.

VIDEO_MFT_OUTPUT_NULL_SAMPLES.description: Does the WMF video decoder return success but null output? 0 = playback successful, 1 = excessive null output but able to decode some frames, 2 = excessive null output and gave up, 3 = null output but recovered, 4 = non-excessive null output without being able to decode frames.

AUDIO_MFT_OUTPUT_NULL_SAMPLES.description: How many times the audio MFT decoder returns success but output nothing.

VIDEO_CAN_CREATE_AAC_DECODER.description: Whether at startup we report we can playback MP4 (AAC) audio. This is single value is recorded at every startup.

VIDEO_CAN_CREATE_H264_DECODER.description: Whether at startup we report we can playback MP4 (H.264) video. This is single value is recorded at every startup.

VIDEO_CANPLAYTYPE_H264_CONSTRAINT_SET_FL.description: The H.264 constraint set flag as extracted from the codecs parameter passed to HTMLMediaElement.canPlayType, with the addition of 0 for unknown values.

VIDEO_CANPLAYTYPE_H264_LEVEL.description: The H.264 level (level_idc) as extracted from the codecs parameter passed to HTMLMediaElement.canPlayType, from levels 1 (10) to 5.2 (51), with the addition of 0 for unknown values.

VIDEO_CANPLAYTYPE_H264_PROFILE.description: The H.264 profile number (profile_idc) as extracted from the codecs parameter passed to HTMLMediaElement.canPlayType.

DECODER_DOCTOR_INFOBAR_STATS.description: Counts of various Decoder Doctor notification events. Used to track efficacy of Decoder Doctor at helping users fix problems with their audio/video codecs. Keys are localized string names that identify problem with audio/video codecs that Decoder Doctor attempts to solve; see string values in dom.properties for verbose description of problems being solved. 0=recorded every time the Decoder Doctor notification is shown, 1=recorded the first time in a profile when notification is shown, 2=recorded when 'Learn how' button clicked, 3=recorded when 'Learn how' button first clicked in a profile, 4=recorded when issue solved after infobar has been shown at least once in a profile.

VIDEO_DECODED_H264_SPS_CONSTRAINT_SET_FL.description: A bit pattern to collect H.264 constraint set flag from the decoded SPS. Bits 0 through 5 represent constraint_set0_flag through constraint_set5_flag, respectively.

VIDEO_DECODED_H264_SPS_LEVEL.description: The H.264 level (level_idc) as extracted from the decoded SPS, from levels 1 (10) to 5.2 (51), with the addition of 0 for unknown values.

VIDEO_DECODED_H264_SPS_PROFILE.description: The H.264 profile number (profile_idc) as extracted from the decoded SPS.

VIDEO_H264_SPS_MAX_NUM_REF_FRAMES.description: SPS.max_num_ref_frames indicates how deep the H.264 queue is going to be, and as such the minimum memory usage by the decoder, from 0 to 16. 17 indicates an invalid value.

WEBRTC_ICE_FINAL_CONNECTION_STATE.description: The ICE connection state when the PC was closed

WEBRTC_ICE_ON_TIME_TRICKLE_ARRIVAL_TIME.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) that a trickle candidate took to arrive after the start of ICE, given that it arrived when ICE was not in a failure state (ie; a candidate that we could do something with, hence 'on time')

WEBRTC_ICE_LATE_TRICKLE_ARRIVAL_TIME.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) that a trickle candidate took to arrive after the start of ICE, given that it arrived after ICE failed.

WEBRTC_ICE_SUCCESS_TIME.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) it took for ICE to complete, given that ICE succeeded.

WEBRTC_ICE_FAILURE_TIME.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) it took for ICE to complete, given that it failed.

WEBRTC_ICE_SUCCESS_RATE.description: The number of failed ICE Connections (0) vs. number of successful ICE connections (1).

WEBRTC_STUN_RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_BY_TYPE_.description: For each successful PeerConnection, bit 0 indicates the short-duration rate limit was reached, bit 1 indicates the long-duration rate limit was reached
For each failed PeerConnection, bit 0 indicates the short-duration rate limit was reached, bit 1 indicates the long-duration rate limit was reached

WEBRTC_AVSYNC_WHEN_AUDIO_LAGS_VIDEO_MS.description: The delay (in milliseconds) when audio is behind video. Zero delay is counted. Measured every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AVSYNC_WHEN_VIDEO_LAGS_AUDIO_MS.description: The delay (in milliseconds) when video is behind audio. Zero delay is not counted. Measured every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_BANDWIDTH_K.description: Locally measured data rate of inbound video (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_BANDWIDTH_K.description: Locally measured data rate on inbound audio (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_BANDWIDTH_.description: Data rate deduced from RTCP from remote recipient of outbound video (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_BANDWIDTH_.description: Data rate deduced from RTCP from remote recipient of outbound audio (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_PACKETLOSS_.description: Locally measured packet loss on inbound video (permille). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_PACKETLOSS_.description: Locally measured packet loss on inbound audio (permille). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_PACKETLOSS.description: RTCP-reported packet loss by remote recipient of outbound video (permille). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_PACKETLOSS.description: RTCP-reported packet loss by remote recipient of outbound audio (permille). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_JITTER.description: Locally measured jitter on inbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_JITTER.description: Locally measured jitter on inbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_JITTER.description: RTCP-reported jitter by remote recipient of outbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_JITTER.description: RTCP-reported jitter by remote recipient of outbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ERROR_RECOVERY_MS.description: Time to recover from a video error in ms

WEBRTC_VIDEO_RECOVERY_BEFORE_ERROR_PER_M.description: Number of losses recovered before error per min

WEBRTC_VIDEO_RECOVERY_AFTER_ERROR_PER_MI.description: Number of losses recovered after error per min

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODE_ERROR_TIME_PERMILLE.description: Percentage*10 (permille) of call decoding with errors or frozen due to errors

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_RTT.description: Roundtrip time of outbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_RTT.description: Roundtrip time of outbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_BITRATE_AVG_PER_CAL.description: Video encoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_BITRATE_STD_DEV_PER.description: Standard deviation from video encoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_FRAMERATE_AVG_PER_C.description: Video encoder's average framerate (in fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_FRAMERATE_10X_STD_D.description: Standard deviation from video encoder's average framerate (in 1/10 fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_DROPPED_FRAMES_PER_.description: Video encoder's number of frames dropped (in frames/min) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_BITRATE_AVG_PER_CAL.description: Video decoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_BITRATE_STD_DEV_PER.description: Standard deviation from video decoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_FRAMERATE_AVG_PER_C.description: Video decoder's average framerate (in fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_FRAMERATE_10X_STD_D.description: Standard deviation from video decoder's average framerate (in 1/10 fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_DISCARDED_PACKETS_P.description: Video decoder's number of discarded packets (in packets/min) over an entire call

WEBRTC_CALL_DURATION.description: The length of time (in seconds) that a call lasted.

WEBRTC_CALL_COUNT.description: The number of calls made during a session.

WEBRTC_CALL_COUNT_2.description: The number of calls made during a session.

WEBRTC_ICE_ADD_CANDIDATE_ERRORS_GIVEN_SU.description: The number of times AddIceCandidate failed on a given PeerConnection, given that ICE succeeded.

WEBRTC_ICE_ADD_CANDIDATE_ERRORS_GIVEN_FA.description: The number of times AddIceCandidate failed on a given PeerConnection, given that ICE failed.

WEBRTC_GET_USER_MEDIA_TYPE.description: Type for media in getUserMedia calls (0=Camera, 1=Screen, 2=Application, 3=Window, 4=Browser, 5=Microphone, 6=AudioCapture, 7=Other)

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_RELAXED.description: Percentage of time spent in the Relaxed load state in calls over 30 seconds.

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_RELAXED_SHORT.description: Percentage of time spent in the Relaxed load state in calls 5-30 seconds.

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_NORMAL.description: Percentage of time spent in the Normal load state in calls over 30 seconds.

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_NORMAL_SHORT.description: Percentage of time spent in the Normal load state in calls over 5-30 seconds.

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_STRESSED.description: Percentage of time spent in the Stressed load state in calls over 30 seconds.

WEBRTC_LOAD_STATE_STRESSED_SHORT.description: Percentage of time spent in the Stressed load state in calls 5-30 seconds.

WEBRTC_RENEGOTIATIONS.description: Number of Renegotiations during each call

WEBRTC_MAX_VIDEO_SEND_TRACK.description: Number of Video tracks sent simultaneously

WEBRTC_MAX_VIDEO_RECEIVE_TRACK.description: Number of Video tracks received simultaneously

WEBRTC_MAX_AUDIO_SEND_TRACK.description: Number of Audio tracks sent simultaneously

WEBRTC_MAX_AUDIO_RECEIVE_TRACK.description: Number of Audio tracks received simultaneously

WEBRTC_CALL_TYPE.description: Type of call: (Bitmask) Audio = 1, Video = 2, DataChannels = 4

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_OTHER_CONNECTION_RESULT.description: Did WebIDE other runtime connection succeed?

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTION_DEBUG_USED.description: Was WebIDE's debug button used during this runtime connection?
