DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTED_RUNTIME_PROCES.description: What runtime processor did WebIDE connect to?

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTED_RUNTIME_OS.description: What runtime OS did WebIDE connect to?

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTED_RUNTIME_PLATFO.description: What runtime platform version did WebIDE connect to?

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTED_RUNTIME_APP_TY.description: What runtime app type did WebIDE connect to?

DEVTOOLS_WEBIDE_CONNECTED_RUNTIME_VERSIO.description: What runtime version did WebIDE connect to?

DEVTOOLS_OS_ENUMERATED_PER_USER.description: OS of DevTools user (0:Windows XP, 1:Windows Vista, 2:Windows 7, 3:Windows 8, 4:Windows 8.1, 5:OSX, 6:Linux 7:Windows 10, 8:reserved, 9:reserved, 10:reserved, 11:reserved, 12:other)

DEVTOOLS_OS_IS_64_BITS_PER_USER.description: OS bit size of DevTools user (0:32bit, 1:64bit, 2:128bit)

DEVTOOLS_TABS_OPEN_PEAK_LINEAR.description: The peak number of open tabs in all windows for a session for devtools users.

DEVTOOLS_TABS_OPEN_AVERAGE_LINEAR.description: The mean number of open tabs in all windows for a session for devtools users.

DEVTOOLS_TABS_PINNED_PEAK_LINEAR.description: The peak number of pinned tabs (app tabs) in all windows for a session for devtools users.

DEVTOOLS_TABS_PINNED_AVERAGE_LINEAR.description: The mean number of pinned tabs (app tabs) in all windows for a session for devtools users.

DEVTOOLS_SAVE_HEAP_SNAPSHOT_MS.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to save a heap snapshot in mozilla::devtools::ChromeUtils::SaveHeapSnapshot.

DEVTOOLS_READ_HEAP_SNAPSHOT_MS.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to read a heap snapshot in mozilla::devtools::ChromeUtils::ReadHeapSnapshot.

DEVTOOLS_HEAP_SNAPSHOT_NODE_COUNT.description: The number of nodes serialized into a heap snapshot.

DEVTOOLS_HEAP_SNAPSHOT_EDGE_COUNT.description: The number of edges serialized into a heap snapshot.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_RECORDING_COUNT.description: Incremented whenever a performance tool recording is completed.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_CONSOLE_RECORDING_COU.description: Incremented whenever a performance tool recording is completed that was initiated via console.profile.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_RECORDING_IMPORT_FLAG.description: When a user imports a recording in the performance tool.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_RECORDING_EXPORT_FLAG.description: When a user imports a recording in the performance tool.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_RECORDING_FEATURES_US.description: When a user starts a recording with specific recording options, keyed by feature name (withMarkers, withAllocations, etc.).

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_RECORDING_DURATION_MS.description: The length of a duration in MS of a performance tool recording.

DEVTOOLS_PERFTOOLS_SELECTED_VIEW_MS.description: The amount of time spent in a specific performance tool view, keyed by view name (waterfall, js-calltree, js-flamegraph, etc).

DEVTOOLS_JAVASCRIPT_ERROR_DISPLAYED.description: Measures whether a particular JavaScript error has been displayed in the webconsole.

DEVTOOLS_TOOLBOX_HOST.description: Records DevTools toolbox host each time the toolbox is opened and when the host is changed (0:Bottom, 1:Side, 2:Window, 3:Custom, 9:Unknown).

VIEW_SOURCE_IN_BROWSER_OPENED_BOOLEAN.description: How many times has view source in browser / tab been opened?

VIEW_SOURCE_IN_WINDOW_OPENED_BOOLEAN.description: How many times has view source in a new window been opened?

VIEW_SOURCE_EXTERNAL_RESULT_BOOLEAN.description: How many times has view source in an external editor been opened, and did it succeed?

BROWSER_IS_USER_DEFAULT.description: The result of the startup default desktop browser check.

BROWSER_IS_USER_DEFAULT_ERROR.description: True if the browser was unable to determine if the browser was set as default.

BROWSER_SET_DEFAULT_DIALOG_PROMPT_RAWCOU.description: The number of times that a profile has seen the 'Set Default Browser' dialog.

BROWSER_SET_DEFAULT_ALWAYS_CHECK.description: True if the profile has `browser.shell.checkDefaultBrowser` set to true.

BROWSER_SET_DEFAULT_RESULT.description: Result of the Set Default Browser dialog (0=Use Firefox + 'Always perform check' unchecked, 1=Use Firefox + 'Always perform check' checked, 2=Not Now + 'Always perform check' unchecked, 3=Not Now + 'Always perform check' checked)

BROWSER_SET_DEFAULT_ERROR.description: True if the browser was unable to set Firefox as the default browser

BROWSER_SET_DEFAULT_TIME_TO_COMPLETION_S.description: Time to successfully set Firefox as the default browser after clicking 'Set Firefox as Default'. Should be near-instant in some environments, others require user interaction. Measured in seconds.

BROWSER_IS_ASSIST_DEFAULT.description: The result of the default browser check for assist intent.

MIXED_CONTENT_PAGE_LOAD.description: Accumulates type of content per page load (0=no mixed or non-secure page, 1=mixed passive, 2=mixed active, 3=mixed passive and mixed active)

MIXED_CONTENT_UNBLOCK_COUNTER.description: A simple counter of daily mixed-content unblock operations and top documents loaded

MIXED_CONTENT_HSTS.description: How often would blocked mixed content be allowed if HSTS upgrades were allowed? 0=display/no-HSTS, 1=display/HSTS, 2=active/no-HSTS, 3=active/HSTS

MIXED_CONTENT_HSTS_PRIMING.description: How often would blocked mixed content be allowed if HSTS upgrades were allowed, including how often would we send an HSTS priming request? 0=display/no-HSTS, 1=display/HSTS, 2=active/no-HSTS, 3=active/HSTS, 4=display/no-HSTS-priming, 5=display/do-HSTS-priming, 6=active/no-HSTS-priming, 7=active/do-HSTS-priming

MIXED_CONTENT_HSTS_PRIMING_RESULT.description: How often do we get back an HSTS priming result which upgrades the connection to HTTPS? 0=cached (no upgrade), 1=cached (do upgrade), 2=cached (blocked), 3=already upgraded, 4=priming succeeded, 5=priming succeeded (block due to pref), 6=priming succeeded (no upgrade due to pref), 7=priming failed (block), 8=priming failed (accept)

HSTS_PRIMING_REQUEST_DURATION.description: The amount of time required for HSTS priming requests (ms), keyed by success or failure of the priming request. (success, failure)

MIXED_CONTENT_OBJECT_SUBREQUEST.description: How often objects load insecure content on secure pages (counting pages, not objects). 0=pages with no mixed object subrequests, 1=pages with mixed object subrequests

COOKIE_SCHEME_SECURITY.description: How often are secure cookies set from non-secure origins, and vice-versa? 0=nonsecure/http, 1=nonsecure/https, 2=secure/http, 3=secure/https

COOKIE_LEAVE_SECURE_ALONE.description: Measuring the effects of draft-ietf-httpbis-cookie-alone blocking. 0=blocked http setting secure cookie; 1=blocked http downgrading secure cookie; 2=blocked evicting secure cookie; 3=evicting newer insecure cookie; 4=evicting the oldest insecure cookie; 5=evicting the preferred cookie; 6=evicting the secure blocked

NTLM_MODULE_USED_2.description: The module used for the NTLM protocol (Windows_API, Kerberos, Samba_auth or Generic) and whether or not the authentication was used to connect to a proxy server. This data is collected only once per session (at first NTLM authentification) ; fixed version.

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_QUEUE_SIZE_ON_CAPTURE.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Size of capture queue when a capture request is received

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_CAPTURE_QUEUE_TIME_MS.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Time the capture request spent in the queue before being serviced (ms)

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_CAPTURE_SERVICE_TIME_MS.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Time the capture took once it started and successfully completed (ms)

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_CAPTURE_DONE_REASON_2.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Reason the capture completed (see TEL_CAPTURE_DONE_* constants in BackgroundPageThumbs.jsm)

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_CAPTURE_PAGE_LOAD_TIME_.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Time the capture's page load took (ms)

FX_THUMBNAILS_BG_CAPTURE_CANVAS_DRAW_TIM.description: BACKGROUND THUMBNAILS: Time it took to draw the capture's window to canvas (ms)

NETWORK_CACHE_V2_MISS_TIME_MS.description: Time spent to find out a cache entry file is missing

NETWORK_CACHE_V2_HIT_TIME_MS.description: Time spent to open an existing file

NETWORK_CACHE_V1_TRUNCATE_TIME_MS.description: Time spent to reopen an entry with OPEN_TRUNCATE

NETWORK_CACHE_V1_MISS_TIME_MS.description: Time spent to find out a cache entry is missing

NETWORK_CACHE_V1_HIT_TIME_MS.description: Time spent to open an existing cache entry

NETWORK_CACHE_V2_OUTPUT_STREAM_STATUS.description: Final status of the CacheFileOutputStream (0=ok, 1=other error, 2=out of memory, 3=disk full, 4=file corrupted, 5=file not found, 6=binding aborted)

NETWORK_CACHE_V2_INPUT_STREAM_STATUS.description: Final status of the CacheFileInputStream (0=ok, 1=other error, 2=out of memory, 3=disk full, 4=file corrupted, 5=file not found, 6=binding aborted)

NETWORK_CACHE_FS_TYPE.description: Type of FS that the cache is stored on (0=NTFS (Win), 1=FAT32 (Win), 2=FAT (Win), 3=other FS (Win), 4=other OS)

NETWORK_CACHE_SIZE_FULL_FAT.description: Size (in MB) of a cache that reached a file count limit

NETWORK_CACHE_HIT_MISS_STAT_PER_CACHE_SI.description: Hit/Miss count split by cache size in file count (0=Hit 0-5000, 1=Miss 0-5000, 2=Hit 5001-10000, ...)

NETWORK_CACHE_HIT_RATE_PER_CACHE_SIZE.description: Hit rate for a specific cache size in file count. The hit rate is split into 20 buckets, the lower limit of the range in percents is 5*n/20. The cache size is divided into 20 ranges of length 5000, the lower limit of the range is 5000*(n%20)

NETWORK_CACHE_METADATA_FIRST_READ_TIME_M.description: Time spent to read the first part of the metadata from the cache entry file.

NETWORK_CACHE_METADATA_SECOND_READ_TIME_.description: Time spent to read the missing part of the metadata from the cache entry file.

NETWORK_CACHE_METADATA_FIRST_READ_SIZE.description: Guessed size of the metadata that we read from the cache file as the first part.

NETWORK_CACHE_METADATA_SIZE.description: Actual size of the metadata parsed from the disk.

NETWORK_CACHE_HASH_STATS.description: The longest hash match between a newly added entry and all the existing entries.

DATABASE_LOCKED_EXCEPTION.description: Record database locks when opening one of Fennec's databases. The index corresponds to how many attempts, beginning with 0.

DATABASE_SUCCESSFUL_UNLOCK.description: Record on which attempt we successfully unlocked a database. See DATABASE_LOCKED_EXCEPTION.

SSL_TLS13_INTOLERANCE_REASON_PRE.description: Potential TLS 1.3 intolerance, before considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS13_INTOLERANCE_REASON_POST.description: Potential TLS 1.3 intolerance, after considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS12_INTOLERANCE_REASON_PRE.description: Potential TLS 1.2 intolerance, before considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS12_INTOLERANCE_REASON_POST.description: Potential TLS 1.2 intolerance, after considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS11_INTOLERANCE_REASON_PRE.description: Potential TLS 1.1 intolerance, before considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS11_INTOLERANCE_REASON_POST.description: Potential TLS 1.1 intolerance, after considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS10_INTOLERANCE_REASON_PRE.description: Potential TLS 1.0 intolerance, before considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_TLS10_INTOLERANCE_REASON_POST.description: Potential TLS 1.0 intolerance, after considering historical info (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_VERSION_FALLBACK_INAPPROPRIATE.description: TLS/SSL version intolerance was falsely detected, server rejected handshake (see tlsIntoleranceTelemetryBucket() in nsNSSIOLayer.cpp).

SSL_WEAK_CIPHERS_FALLBACK.description: Fallback attempted when server did not support any strong cipher suites

SSL_CIPHER_SUITE_FULL.description: Negotiated cipher suite in full handshake (see key in HandshakeCallback in nsNSSCallbacks.cpp)

SSL_CIPHER_SUITE_RESUMED.description: Negotiated cipher suite in resumed handshake (see key in HandshakeCallback in nsNSSCallbacks.cpp)

SSL_KEA_RSA_KEY_SIZE_FULL.description: RSA KEA (TLS_RSA_*) key size in full handshake

SSL_KEA_DHE_KEY_SIZE_FULL.description: DHE KEA (TLS_DHE_*) key size in full handshake

SSL_KEA_ECDHE_CURVE_FULL.description: ECDHE KEA (TLS_ECDHE_*) curve (23=P-256, 24=P-384, 25=P-521) in full handshake

SSL_AUTH_ALGORITHM_FULL.description: SSL Authentication Algorithm (null=0, rsa=1, dsa=2, ecdsa=4) in full handshake

SSL_AUTH_RSA_KEY_SIZE_FULL.description: RSA signature key size for TLS_*_RSA_* in full handshake

SSL_AUTH_ECDSA_CURVE_FULL.description: ECDSA signature curve for TLS_*_ECDSA_* in full handshake (23=P-256, 24=P-384, 25=P-521)

SSL_SYMMETRIC_CIPHER_FULL.description: Symmetric cipher used in full handshake (null=0, rc4=1, 3des=4, aes-cbc=7, camellia=8, seed=9, aes-gcm=10)

SSL_SYMMETRIC_CIPHER_RESUMED.description: Symmetric cipher used in resumed handshake (null=0, rc4=1, 3des=4, aes-cbc=7, camellia=8, seed=9, aes-gcm=10)

SSL_REASONS_FOR_NOT_FALSE_STARTING.description: Bitmask of reasons we did not false start when libssl would have let us (see key in nsNSSCallbacks.cpp)

SSL_HANDSHAKE_TYPE.description: Type of handshake (1=resumption, 2=false started, 3=chose not to false start, 4=not allowed to false start)

SSL_OCSP_STAPLING.description: Status of OCSP stapling on this handshake (1=present, good; 2=none; 3=present, expired; 4=present, other error)

SSL_OCSP_MAY_FETCH.description: For non-stapling cases, is OCSP fetching a possibility? (0=yes, 1=no because missing/invalid OCSP URI, 2=no because fetching disabled, 3=no because both)

SSL_CERT_ERROR_OVERRIDES.description: Was a certificate error overridden on this handshake? What was it? (0=unknown error (indicating bug), 1=no, >1=a specific error)

SSL_CERT_VERIFICATION_ERRORS.description: If certificate verification failed in a TLS handshake, what was the error? (see MapCertErrorToProbeValue in security/manager/ssl/SSLServerCertVerification.cpp and the values in security/pkix/include/pkix/Result.h)

SSL_PERMANENT_CERT_ERROR_OVERRIDES.description: How many permanent certificate overrides a user has stored.

SSL_SCTS_ORIGIN.description: Origin of Signed Certificate Timestamps received (1=Embedded, 2=TLS handshake extension, 3=Stapled OCSP response)

SSL_SCTS_PER_CONNECTION.description: Histogram of Signed Certificate Timestamps per SSL connection, from all sources (embedded / OCSP Stapling / TLS handshake). Bucket 0 counts the cases when no SCTs were received, or none were extracted due to parsing errors.

SSL_SCTS_VERIFICATION_STATUS.description: Verification status of Signed Certificate Timestamps received (0=Decoding error, 1=SCT verified, 2=SCT from unknown log, 3=Invalid SCT signature, 4=SCT timestamp is in the future)

SSL_SERVER_AUTH_EKU.description: Presence of of the Server Authenticaton EKU in accepted SSL server certificates (0=No EKU, 1=EKU present and has id_kp_serverAuth, 2=EKU present and has id_kp_serverAuth as well as some other EKU, 3=EKU present but does not contain id_kp_serverAuth)

TELEMETRY_TEST_EXPIRED.description: a testing histogram; not meant to be touched

TLS_ERROR_REPORT_UI.description: User interaction with the TLS Error Reporter in about:neterror (0=Error seen, 1='auto' checked, 2='auto' unchecked, 3=Sent manually, 4=Sent automatically, 5=Send success, 6=Send failure, 7=Report section expanded)

CERT_OCSP_REQUIRED.description: Is OCSP required when the cert has an OCSP URI? (pref security.OCSP.require)

OSFILE_WORKER_LAUNCH_MS.description: The duration between the instant the first message is sent to OS.File and the moment the OS.File worker starts executing JavaScript, in milliseconds

OSFILE_WORKER_READY_MS.description: The duration between the instant the first message is sent to OS.File and the moment the OS.File worker has finished executing its startup JavaScript and is ready to receive requests, in milliseconds

OSFILE_WRITEATOMIC_JANK_MS.description: The duration during which the main thread is blocked during a call to OS.File.writeAtomic, in milliseconds

CERT_EV_STATUS.description: EV status of a certificate, recorded on each TLS connection. 0=invalid, 1=DV, 2=EV

CERT_VALIDATION_SUCCESS_BY_CA.description: Successful SSL server cert validations by CA (see RootHashes.inc for names of CAs)

CERT_PINNING_FAILURES_BY_CA.description: Pinning failures by CA (see RootHashes.inc for names of CAs)

CERT_PINNING_TEST_RESULTS.description: Certificate pinning test results (0 = failure, 1 = success)

CERT_PINNING_MOZ_RESULTS.description: Certificate pinning results for Mozilla sites (0 = failure, 1 = success)

CERT_PINNING_MOZ_TEST_RESULTS.description: Certificate pinning test results for Mozilla sites (0 = failure, 1 = success)

CERT_PINNING_MOZ_RESULTS_BY_HOST.description: Certificate pinning results by host for Mozilla operational sites

CERT_PINNING_MOZ_TEST_RESULTS_BY_HOST.description: Certificate pinning test results by host for Mozilla operational sites

CERT_CHAIN_KEY_SIZE_STATUS.description: Does enforcing a larger minimum RSA key size cause verification failures? 1 = no, 2 = yes, 3 = another error prevented finding a verified chain

CERT_CHAIN_SHA1_POLICY_STATUS.description: 1 = No SHA1 signatures, 2 = SHA1 certificates issued by an imported root, 3 = SHA1 certificates issued before 2016, 4 = SHA1 certificates issued after 2015, 5 = another error prevented successful verification

WEAVE_CONFIGURED.description: If any version of Firefox Sync is configured for this device

WEAVE_CONFIGURED_MASTER_PASSWORD.description: If both Firefox Sync and Master Password are configured for this device

WEAVE_START_COUNT.description: The number of times a sync started in this session

WEAVE_COMPLETE_SUCCESS_COUNT.description: The number of times a sync successfully completed in this session

WEAVE_WIPE_SERVER_SUCCEEDED.description: Stores 1 if a wipeServer call succeeded, and 0 if it failed.

WEBCRYPTO_EXTRACTABLE_IMPORT.description: Whether an imported key was marked as extractable

WEBCRYPTO_EXTRACTABLE_GENERATE.description: Whether a generated key was marked as extractable

WEBCRYPTO_EXTRACTABLE_ENC.description: Whether a key used in an encrypt/decrypt operation was marked as extractable

WEBCRYPTO_EXTRACTABLE_SIG.description: Whether a key used in a sign/verify operation was marked as extractable

WEBCRYPTO_RESOLVED.description: Whether a promise created by WebCrypto was resolved (vs rejected)

WEBCRYPTO_ALG.description: Algorithms used with WebCrypto (see table in WebCryptoTask.cpp)

MASTER_PASSWORD_ENABLED.description: If a master-password is enabled for this profile

DISPLAY_SCALING_OSX.description: Scaling percentage for the display where the first window is opened (OS X only)

DISPLAY_SCALING_MSWIN.description: Scaling percentage for the display where the first window is opened (MS Windows only)

DISPLAY_SCALING_LINUX.description: Scaling percentage for the display where the first window is opened (Linux only)

SOCIAL_SIDEBAR_STATE.description: Social Sidebar state 0: closed, 1: opened.  Toggling between providers will result in a higher opened rate.

SOCIAL_TOOLBAR_BUTTONS.description: Social toolbar button has been used (0:share, 1:status, 2:bookmark)

SOCIAL_PANEL_CLICKS.description: Social content has been interacted with (0:share, 1:status, 2:bookmark, 3: sidebar)

SOCIAL_SIDEBAR_OPEN_DURATION.description: Sidebar showing: seconds that the sidebar has been opened

SHUTDOWN_PHASE_DURATION_TICKS_QUIT_APPLI.description: Duration of shutdown phase quit-application, as measured by the shutdown terminator, in seconds of activity

SHUTDOWN_PHASE_DURATION_TICKS_PROFILE_CH.description: Duration of shutdown phase profile-change-teardown, as measured by the shutdown terminator, in seconds of activity

SHUTDOWN_PHASE_DURATION_TICKS_XPCOM_WILL.description: Duration of shutdown phase xpcom-will-shutdown, as measured by the shutdown terminator, in seconds of activity

SHUTDOWN_PHASE_DURATION_TICKS_PROFILE_BE.description: Duration of shutdown phase profile-before-change, as measured by the shutdown terminator, in seconds of activity

BR_9_2_1_SUBJECT_ALT_NAMES.description: Baseline Requirements section 9.2.1: subject alternative names extension (0: ok, 1 or more: error)

BR_9_2_2_SUBJECT_COMMON_NAME.description: Baseline Requirements section 9.2.2: subject common name field (0: present, in subject alt. names; 1: not present; 2: not present in subject alt. names)

TAP_TO_LOAD_ENABLED.description: Whether or not a user has tap-to-load enabled.

ZOOMED_VIEW_ENABLED.description: Whether or not a user has the zoomed view (a.k.a. "Magnify small areas") enabled.

TRACKING_PROTECTION_ENABLED.description: Whether or not a session has tracking protection enabled

TRACKING_PROTECTION_PBM_DISABLED.description: Is the tracking protection in private browsing mode disabled?

FENNEC_TRACKING_PROTECTION_STATE.description: The state of the user-visible tracking protection setting (0 = Disabled, 1 = Enabled in PB, 2 = Enabled)

TRACKING_PROTECTION_SHIELD.description: Tracking protection shield (0 = not shown, 1 = loaded, 2 = blocked)

SERVICE_WORKER_REGISTRATION_LOADING.description: Tracking how ServiceWorkerRegistrar loads data before the first content is shown. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_REQUEST_PASSTHROUGH.description: Intercepted fetch sending back same Request object. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

E10S_STATUS.description: Why e10s is enabled or disabled (0=ENABLED_BY_USER, 1=ENABLED_BY_DEFAULT, 2=DISABLED_BY_USER, 3=DISABLED_IN_SAFE_MODE, 4=DISABLED_FOR_ACCESSIBILITY, 5=DISABLED_FOR_MAC_GFX, 6=DISABLED_FOR_BIDI, 7=DISABLED_FOR_ADDONS, 8=FORCE_DISABLED, 9=DISABLED_FOR_XPLAYERS, 10=DISABLED_FOR_OS_VERSION)

E10S_WINDOW.description: Whether a browser window is set as an e10s window

E10S_BLOCKED_FROM_RUNNING.description: Whether the e10s pref was set but it was blocked from running due to blacklisted conditions

BLOCKED_ON_PLUGIN_MODULE_INIT_MS.description: Time (ms) that the main thread has been blocked on LoadModule and NP_Initialize in PluginModuleParent

BLOCKED_ON_PLUGIN_INSTANCE_INIT_MS.description: Time (ms) that the main thread has been blocked on NPP_New in an IPC plugin

BLOCKED_ON_PLUGIN_STREAM_INIT_MS.description: Time (ms) that the main thread has been blocked on NPP_NewStream in an IPC plugin

BLOCKED_ON_PLUGINASYNCSURROGATE_WAITFORI.description: Time (ms) that the main thread has been blocked on PluginAsyncSurrogate::WaitForInit in an IPC plugin

BLOCKED_ON_PLUGIN_INSTANCE_DESTROY_MS.description: Time (ms) that the main thread has been blocked on NPP_Destroy in an IPC plugin

ONBEFOREUNLOAD_PROMPT_ACTION.description: What button a user clicked in an onbeforeunload prompt.  (Stay on Page = 0, Leave Page = 1, prompt aborted = 2)

ONBEFOREUNLOAD_PROMPT_COUNT.description: How many onbeforeunload prompts has the user encountered in their session?

SUBPROCESS_ABNORMAL_ABORT.description: Counts of plugin/content process abnormal shutdown, whether or not a crash report was available.

SUBPROCESS_CRASHES_WITH_DUMP.description: Counts of plugin and content process crashes which are reported with a crash dump.

SUBPROCESS_LAUNCH_FAILURE.description: Counts the number of times launching a subprocess fails. Counts are by subprocess-type using the GeckoProcessType enum.

PROCESS_CRASH_SUBMIT_ATTEMPT.description: An attempt to submit a crash. Keyed on the CrashManager Crash.type.

PROCESS_CRASH_SUBMIT_SUCCESS.description: The submission status when main/plugin/content crashes are submitted. 1 is success, 0 is failure. Keyed on the CrashManager Crash.type.

STUMBLER_TIME_BETWEEN_UPLOADS_SEC.description: Stumbler: The time in seconds between uploads.

STUMBLER_VOLUME_BYTES_UPLOADED_PER_SEC.description: Stumbler: Volume measurement of bytes uploaded, normalized to per-second.

STUMBLER_TIME_BETWEEN_START_SEC.description: Stumbler: The time between the service starts.

STUMBLER_UPLOAD_WIFI_AP_COUNT.description: Stumbler: The Wi-Fi APs per upload.

STUMBLER_OBSERVATIONS_PER_DAY.description: Stumbler: The number of observations between upload events, normalized to per day.

STUMBLER_TIME_BETWEEN_RECEIVED_LOCATIONS.description: Stumbler: The time between receiving passive locations.

DATA_STORAGE_ENTRIES.description: The number of entries in persistent DataStorage (HSTS and HPKP data, basically)

VIDEO_EME_PLAY_SUCCESS.description: EME video playback success or failure

VIDEO_PLAY_TIME_MS.description: Total time spent playing video in milliseconds. This reports the total play time for an HTML Media Element whenever it is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded, or when the mute status changes when the AudioChannelAPI pref is set.

VIDEO_HIDDEN_PLAY_TIME_MS.description: Total time spent playing video while element is hidden, in milliseconds. This reports the total hidden play time for an HTML Media Element whenever it is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded, or when the mute status changes when the AudioChannelAPI pref is set.

VIDEO_HIDDEN_PLAY_TIME_PERCENTAGE.description: Percentage of total time spent playing video while element is hidden. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INFERRED_DECODE_SUSPEND_PERCENTAGE.description: Percentage of total time spent *not* fully decoding video while element is hidden (simulated, even when feature is not enabled). Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INTER_KEYFRAME_AVERAGE_MS.description: Average interval between video keyframes in played videos, in milliseconds. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INTER_KEYFRAME_MAX_MS.description: Maximum interval between video keyframes in played videos, in milliseconds; '0' means only 1 keyframe found. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_SUSPEND_RECOVERY_TIME_MS.description: Time taken for a video to resume after decoding was suspended, in milliseconds. Keyed by audio presence, hw acceleration, and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0-240', 'AV(hw),2160+'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages.

VIDEO_AS_CONTENT_SOURCE.description: Usage of a {visible / invisible} video element as the source of {drawImage(), createPattern(), createImageBitmap() and captureStream()} APIs. (0 = ALL_VISIBLE, 1 = ALL_INVISIBLE, 2 = drawImage_VISIBLE, 3 = drawImage_INVISIBLE, 4 = createPattern_VISIBLE, 5 = createPattern_INVISIBLE, 6 = createImageBitmap_VISIBLE, 7 = createImageBitmap_INVISIBLE, 8 = captureStream_VISIBLE, 9 = captureStream_INVISIBLE)

VIDEO_AS_CONTENT_SOURCE_IN_TREE_OR_NOT.description: Usage of an invisible {in tree / not in tree} video element as the source of {drawImage(), createPattern(), createImageBitmap() and captureStream()} APIs. (0 = ALL_IN_TREE, 1 = ALL_NOT_IN_TREE, 2 = drawImage_IN_TREE, 3 = drawImage_NOT_IN_TREE, 4 = createPattern_IN_TREE, 5 = createPattern_NOT_IN_TREE, 6 = createImageBitmap_IN_TREE, 7 = createImageBitmap_NOT_IN_TREE, 8 = captureStream_IN_TREE, 9 = captureStream_NOT_IN_TREE)

VIDEO_UNLOAD_STATE.description: HTML Media Element state when unloading. ended = 0, paused = 1, stalled = 2, seeking = 3, other = 4

VIDEO_VP9_BENCHMARK_FPS.description: 720p VP9 decode benchmark measurement in frames per second

VIDEO_CDM_CREATED.description: Note the type of CDM (0=ClearKey, 1=Primetime, 2=Widevine, 3=unknown) every time we successfully instantiate an EME MediaKeys object.

VIDEO_CDM_GENERATE_REQUEST_CALLED.description: Note the type of CDM (0=ClearKey, 1=Primetime, 2=Widevine, 3=unknown) every time we call MediaKeySession.generateRequest().

MEDIA_CODEC_USED.description: Count of use of audio/video codecs in HTMLMediaElements and WebAudio. Those with 'resource' prefix are approximate; report based on HTTP ContentType or sniffing. Those with 'webaudio' prefix are for WebAudio.

FX_SANITIZE_TOTAL.description: Sanitize: Total time it takes to sanitize (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_CACHE.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize the cache (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_COOKIES_2.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize firefox cookies (ms). A subset of FX_SANITIZE_COOKIES.

FX_SANITIZE_LOADED_FLASH.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize Flash when it's already loaded (ms). A subset of FX_SANITIZE_PLUGINS.

FX_SANITIZE_UNLOADED_FLASH.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize Flash when it's not yet loaded (ms). A subset of FX_SANITIZE_PLUGINS.

FX_SANITIZE_HISTORY.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize history (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_FORMDATA.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize stored form data (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_DOWNLOADS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize recent downloads (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_SESSIONS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize saved sessions (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_SITESETTINGS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize site-specific settings (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_OPENWINDOWS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize the open windows list (ms)

PWMGR_BLOCKLIST_NUM_SITES.description: The number of sites for which the user has explicitly rejected saving logins

PWMGR_FORM_AUTOFILL_RESULT.description: The result of auto-filling a login form. See http://mzl.la/1Mbs6jL for bucket descriptions.

PWMGR_LOGIN_LAST_USED_DAYS.description: Time in days each saved login was last used

PWMGR_LOGIN_PAGE_SAFETY.description: The safety of a page where we see a password field. (0: safe page & safe submit; 1: safe page & unsafe submit; 2: safe page & unknown submit; 3: unsafe page & safe submit; 4: unsafe page & unsafe submit; 5: unsafe page & unknown submit)

PWMGR_MANAGE_COPIED_PASSWORD.description: Count of passwords copied from the password management interface

PWMGR_MANAGE_COPIED_USERNAME.description: Count of usernames copied from the password management interface

PWMGR_MANAGE_DELETED.description: Count of passwords deleted from the password management interface (including via Remove All)

PWMGR_MANAGE_DELETED_ALL.description: Count of times that Remove All was used from the password management interface

PWMGR_MANAGE_OPENED.description: Accumulates how the password management interface was opened. (0=Preferences, 1=Page Info)

PWMGR_MANAGE_SORTED.description: Reports the column that logins are sorted by

PWMGR_MANAGE_VISIBILITY_TOGGLED.description: Whether the visibility of passwords was toggled (0=Hide, 1=Show)

PWMGR_NUM_PASSWORDS_PER_HOSTNAME.description: The number of passwords per hostname

PWMGR_NUM_SAVED_PASSWORDS.description: Total number of saved logins, including those that cannot be decrypted

PWMGR_PASSWORD_INPUT_IN_FORM.description: Whether an <input type=password> is associated with a <form> when it is added to a document

PWMGR_PROMPT_REMEMBER_ACTION.description: Action taken by user through prompt for creating a login. (0=Prompt displayed [always recorded], 1=Add login, 2=Don't save now, 3=Never save)

PWMGR_PROMPT_UPDATE_ACTION.description: Action taken by user through prompt for modifying a login. (0=Prompt displayed [always recorded], 1=Update login)

PWMGR_SAVING_ENABLED.description: Number of users who have password saving on globally

PWMGR_USERNAME_PRESENT.description: Whether a saved login has a username

FENNEC_SYNC11_MIGRATION_SENTINELS_SEEN.description: The number of Sync 1.1 -> Sync 1.5 migration sentinels seen by Android Sync.

FENNEC_SYNC11_MIGRATIONS_FAILED.description: The number of Sync 1.1 -> Sync 1.5 migrations that failed during Android Sync.

FENNEC_SYNC11_MIGRATIONS_SUCCEEDED.description: The number of Sync 1.1 -> Sync 1.5 migrations that succeeded during Android Sync.

FENNEC_SYNC11_MIGRATION_NOTIFICATIONS_OF.description: The number of Sync 1.5 'complete upgrade/migration' notifications offered by Android Sync.

FENNEC_SYNC11_MIGRATIONS_COMPLETED.description: The number of Sync 1.5 migrations completed by Android Sync.

FENNEC_SYNC_NUMBER_OF_SYNCS_STARTED.description: Counts the number of times that a sync has started.

FENNEC_SYNC_NUMBER_OF_SYNCS_COMPLETED.description: Counts the number of times that a sync has completed with no errors.

FENNEC_SYNC_NUMBER_OF_SYNCS_FAILED.description: Counts the number of times that a sync has failed with errors.

FENNEC_SYNC_NUMBER_OF_SYNCS_FAILED_BACKO.description: Counts the number of times that a sync has failed because of trying to sync before server backoff interval has passed.

SLOW_SCRIPT_PAGE_COUNT.description: The number of pages that trigger slow script notices

SLOW_SCRIPT_NOTIFY_DELAY.description: The difference between the js slow script timeout for content set in prefs and the actual time we waited before displaying the notification (msec).

PLUGIN_HANG_NOTICE_COUNT.description: Count plugin hang notices in e10s

SERVICE_WORKER_SPAWN_ATTEMPTS.description: Count attempts to spawn a ServiceWorker for a domain. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_WAS_SPAWNED.description: Count ServiceWorkers that really did get a thread created for them. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a ServiceWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SHARED_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a SharedWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

DEDICATED_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a DedicatedWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_REGISTRATIONS.description: Count how many registrations occurs. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_CONTROLLED_DOCUMENTS.description: Count whenever a document is controlled. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_UPDATED.description: Count ServiceWorkers scripts that are updated. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_LIFE_TIME.description: Tracking how long a ServiceWorker stays alive after it is spawned. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

GRAPHICS_SANITY_TEST.description: Reports results from the graphics sanity test to track which drivers are having problems (0=TEST_PASSED, 1=TEST_FAILED_RENDER, 2=TEST_FAILED_VIDEO, 3=TEST_CRASHED)

READER_MODE_PARSE_RESULT.description: The result of trying to parse a document to show in reader view (0=Success, 1=Error too many elements, 2=Error in worker, 3=Error no article)

READER_MODE_DOWNLOAD_RESULT.description: The result of trying to download a document to show in reader view (0=Success, 1=Error XHR, 2=Error no document)

FENNEC_LOAD_SAVED_PAGE.description: How often users load saved items when online/offline (0=RL online, 1=RL offline, 2=BM online, 3=BM offline)

DEFECTIVE_PERMISSIONS_SQL_REMOVED.description: Record the removal of defective permissions.sqlite

FENNEC_TABQUEUE_QUEUESIZE.description: The number of tabs queued when opened.

FENNEC_CUSTOM_HOMEPAGE.description: Whether the user has set a custom homepage.

GRAPHICS_DRIVER_STARTUP_TEST.description: Reports whether or not graphics drivers crashed during startup.

GRAPHICS_SANITY_TEST_OS_SNAPSHOT.description: Reports whether the graphics sanity test passed an OS snapshot test. 0=Pass, 1=Fail, 2=Error, 3=Timed out.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_JANK.description: The duration which a thread is blocked in ms, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_REFLOW_DURATION.description: The duration a reflow takes in ms, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_REFLOWS.description: A count of the number of reflows, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_SECURITY_CATEGORY.description: The security error enums, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_ERRORS.description: Number of errors, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_WARNINGS.description: Number of warnings, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_USS.description: The USS memory consumed by an application, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_CONTENTINT.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'contentInteractive' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_NAVIGATION.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'navigationInteractive' performance mark, keyed by appName.
The duration in ms between application launch and the 'navigationLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_VISUALLYLO.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'visuallyLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_MEDIAENUME.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'mediaEnumerated' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_FULLYLOADE.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'fullyLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_STARTUP_TIME_SCANEND.description: The duration in ms between application launch and the 'scanEnd' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_CONTENTINTERACTI.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'contentInteractive' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_NAVIGATIONINTERA.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'navigationInteractive' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_NAVIGATIONLOADED.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'navigationLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_VISUALLYLOADED_V.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'visuallyLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_MEDIAENUMERATED_.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'mediaEnumerated' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_FULLYLOADED_V2.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'fullyLoaded' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_HUD_APP_MEMORY_SCANEND_V2.description: The USS memory consumed by an application at the time of the 'scanEnd' performance mark, keyed by appName.

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_TAKE_SNAPSHOT_COUNT.description: The number of heap snapshots taken by a user

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_IMPORT_SNAPSHOT_COUNT.description: The number of heap snapshots imported by a user

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_EXPORT_SNAPSHOT_COUNT.description: The number of heap snapshots exported by a user

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_FILTER_CENSUS.description: Whether a census tree was filtered or not

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_DIFF_CENSUS.description: Whether a census was the result of diffing or not

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_INVERTED_CENSUS.description: Whether a census tree was inverted or not

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_BREAKDOWN_CENSUS_COUNT.description: The number of times a given type of breakdown was used for a census

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_DOMINATOR_TREE_COUNT.description: The number of times a user requested a dominator tree be computed

DEVTOOLS_MEMORY_BREAKDOWN_DOMINATOR_TREE.description: The number of times a given type of breakdown was used for a dominator tree

GRAPHICS_SANITY_TEST_REASON.description: Reports why a graphics sanity test was run. 0=First Run, 1=App Updated, 2=Device Change, 3=Driver Change.

TRANSLATION_OPPORTUNITIES.description: A number of successful and failed attempts to translate a document

TRANSLATION_OPPORTUNITIES_BY_LANGUAGE.description: A number of successful and failed attempts to translate a document grouped by language

TRANSLATED_PAGES.description: A number of sucessfully translated pages

TRANSLATED_PAGES_BY_LANGUAGE.description: A number of sucessfully translated pages by language

TRANSLATED_CHARACTERS.description: A number of sucessfully translated characters

DENIED_TRANSLATION_OFFERS.description: A number of tranlation offers the user denied

AUTO_REJECTED_TRANSLATION_OFFERS.description: A number of auto-rejected tranlation offers

REQUESTS_OF_ORIGINAL_CONTENT.description: A number of times the user requested to see the original content of a translated page

CHANGES_OF_TARGET_LANGUAGE.description: A number of times when the target language was changed by the user

CHANGES_OF_DETECTED_LANGUAGE.description: A number of changes of detected language before (true) or after (false) translating a page for the first time.

SHOULD_TRANSLATION_UI_APPEAR.description: Tracks situations when the user opts for displaying translation UI

SHOULD_AUTO_DETECT_LANGUAGE.description: Tracks situations when the user opts for auto-detecting the language of a page

PERMISSIONS_REMIGRATION_COMPARISON.description: Reports a comparison between row count of original and re-migration of the v7 permissions DB. 0=New == 0, 1=New < Old, 2=New == Old, 3=New > Old

PERMISSIONS_MIGRATION_7_ERROR.description: Was there an error while performing the v7 permissions DB migration?

PERF_MONITORING_TEST_CPU_RESCHEDULING_PR.description: Proportion (%) of reschedulings of the main process to another CPU during the execution of code inside a JS compartment. Updated while we are measuring jank.

PERF_MONITORING_SLOW_ADDON_JANK_US.description: Contiguous time spent by an add-on blocking the main loop (microseconds, keyed by add-on ID).

PERF_MONITORING_SLOW_ADDON_CPOW_US.description: Contiguous time spent by an add-on blocking the main loop by performing a blocking cross-process call (microseconds, keyed by add-on ID).

VIDEO_EME_REQUEST_SUCCESS_LATENCY_MS.description: Time spent waiting for a navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess call to succeed.

VIDEO_EME_REQUEST_FAILURE_LATENCY_MS.description: Time spent waiting for a navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess call to fail.

FXA_CONFIGURED.description: If the user is signed in to a Firefox Account on this device. Recorded once per session just after startup as Sync is initialized.

WEAVE_DEVICE_COUNT_DESKTOP.description: Number of desktop devices (including this device) associated with this Sync account. Recorded each time Sync successfully completes the 'clients' engine.

WEAVE_DEVICE_COUNT_MOBILE.description: Number of mobile devices associated with this Sync account. Recorded each time Sync successfully completes the 'clients' engine.

WEAVE_ENGINE_SYNC_ERRORS.description: Exceptions thrown by a Sync engine. Keyed on the engine name.

CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED.description: Number of content documents destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

TOP_LEVEL_CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED.description: Number of top-level content documents destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

PUSH_API_USED.description: A Push API subscribe() operation was performed at least once this session.

PUSH_API_PERMISSION_REQUESTED.description: Count of number of times the PermissionManager explicitly prompted user for Push Notifications permission

PUSH_API_PERMISSION_DENIED.description: User explicitly denied Push Notifications permission

PUSH_API_PERMISSION_GRANTED.description: User explicitly granted Push Notifications permission

PUSH_API_SUBSCRIBE_ATTEMPT.description: Push Service attempts to subscribe with Push Server.

PUSH_API_SUBSCRIBE_FAILED.description: Attempt to subscribe with Push Server failed.

PUSH_API_SUBSCRIBE_SUCCEEDED.description: Attempt to subscribe with Push Server succeeded.

PUSH_API_UNSUBSCRIBE_ATTEMPT.description: Push Service attempts to unsubscribe with Push Server.

PUSH_API_UNSUBSCRIBE_FAILED.description: Attempt to unsubscribe with Push Server failed.

PUSH_API_UNSUBSCRIBE_SUCCEEDED.description: Attempt to unsubscribe with Push Server succeeded.

PUSH_API_SUBSCRIBE_WS_TIME.description: Time taken to subscribe over WebSocket (ms).

PUSH_API_SUBSCRIBE_HTTP2_TIME.description: Time taken to subscribe over HTTP2 (ms).

PUSH_API_QUOTA_EXPIRATION_TIME.description: Time taken for a push subscription to expire its quota (seconds). The maximum is just over an year.

PUSH_API_QUOTA_RESET_TO.description: The value a push record quota (a count) is reset to based on the user's browsing history.

PUSH_API_NOTIFICATION_RECEIVED.description: Push notification was received from server.

PUSH_API_NOTIFICATION_RECEIVED_BUT_DID_N.description: Push notification was received from server, but not delivered to ServiceWorker. Enumeration values are defined in dom/push/PushService.jsm as kDROP_NOTIFICATION_REASON_*.

PUSH_API_NOTIFY.description: Number of push messages that were successfully decrypted and delivered to a ServiceWorker.

PUSH_API_NOTIFY_REGISTRATION_LOST.description: Attempt to notify ServiceWorker of push notification resubscription.

D3D11_SYNC_HANDLE_FAILURE.description: Number of times the D3D11 compositor failed to get a texture sync handle.

GFX_CONTENT_FAILED_TO_ACQUIRE_DEVICE.description: Failed to create a gfx content device. 0=content d3d11, 1=image d3d11, 2=d2d1.

PLUGIN_ACTIVATION_COUNT.description: Counts number of times a certain plugin has been activated.

SCROLL_INPUT_METHODS.description: Count of scroll actions triggered by different input methods. See gfx/layers/apz/util/ScrollInputMethods.h for a list of possible values and their meanings.

WEB_NOTIFICATION_CLICKED.description: Count of times a web notification was clicked

WEB_NOTIFICATION_MENU.description: Count of times a contextual menu item was used from a Notification (0: DND, 1: Disable, 2: Settings)

WEB_NOTIFICATION_SHOWN.description: Count of times a Notification was rendered (accounting for XUL DND). A system backend may put the notification directly into the tray if its own DND is on.

WEBFONT_DOWNLOAD_TIME_AFTER_START.description: Time after navigationStart webfont download completed (ms)

WEBFONT_SRCTYPE.description: Font src type loaded (1 = local, 2 = url, 3 = data)

WEBFONT_PER_PAGE.description: Number of fonts loaded at page load

WEBFONT_SIZE_PER_PAGE.description: Size of all fonts loaded at page load (kb)

WEBRTC_ICE_CHECKING_RATE.description: The number of ICE connections which immediately failed (0) vs. reached at least checking state (1).

ALERTS_SERVICE_DND_ENABLED.description: XUL-only: whether the user has toggled do not disturb.

ALERTS_SERVICE_DND_SUPPORTED_FLAG.description: Whether the do not disturb option is supported. True if the browser uses XUL alerts.

WEB_NOTIFICATION_EXCEPTIONS_OPENED.description: Number of times the Notification Permissions dialog has been opened.

WEB_NOTIFICATION_PERMISSIONS.description: Number of origins with the web notifications permission (0 = denied, 1 = allowed).

WEB_NOTIFICATION_PERMISSION_REMOVED.description: Number of removed web notifications permissions (0 = remove deny, 1 = remove allow).

WEB_NOTIFICATION_SENDERS.description: Number of origins that have shown a web notification. Excludes system alerts like update reminders and add-ons.

YOUTUBE_REWRITABLE_EMBED_SEEN.description: Flag activated whenever a rewritable youtube flash embed is seen during a session.

YOUTUBE_NONREWRITABLE_EMBED_SEEN.description: Flag activated whenever a non-rewritable (enablejsapi=1) youtube flash embed is seen during a session.

PLUGIN_DRAWING_MODEL.description: Plugin drawing model. 0 when windowed, otherwise NPDrawingModel + 1.

WEB_NOTIFICATION_REQUEST_PERMISSION_CALL.description: Usage of the deprecated Notification.requestPermission() callback argument

VIDEO_DROPPED_FRAMES_PROPORTION.description: Percentage of frames decoded frames dropped in an HTMLVideoElement

TAB_SWITCH_CACHE_POSITION.description: Position in (theoretical) tab cache of tab being switched to

IPC_MESSAGE_SIZE.description: Measures the size of IPC messages by message name

IPC_REPLY_SIZE.description: Measures the size of IPC messages by message name

MESSAGE_MANAGER_MESSAGE_SIZE2.description: Each key is the message name, with digits removed, from an async message manager message that was larger than 8192 bytes, recorded in the sending process at the time of sending.

REJECTED_MESSAGE_MANAGER_MESSAGE.description: Each key is the message name, with digits removed, from an async message manager message that was rejected for being over approximately 128MB, recorded in the sending process at the time of sending.

SANDBOX_HAS_SECCOMP_BPF.description: Whether the system has seccomp-bpf capability

SANDBOX_HAS_SECCOMP_TSYNC.description: Whether the system has seccomp-bpf thread-sync capability

SANDBOX_HAS_USER_NAMESPACES.description: Whether our process succedeed in creating a user namespace

SANDBOX_HAS_USER_NAMESPACES_PRIVILEGED.description: Whether the system has the capability to create privileged user namespaces

SANDBOX_MEDIA_ENABLED.description: Whether the sandbox is enabled for media/GMP plugins

SANDBOX_CONTENT_ENABLED.description: Whether the sandbox is enabled for the content process

SYNC_WORKER_OPERATION.description: Tracking how long a Worker thread is blocked when a sync operation is executed on the main-thread.

SUBPROCESS_KILL_HARD.description: Counts the number of times a subprocess was forcibly killed, and the reason.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_DUMP_UNAVAILABLE.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed was unable to find a crash dump.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_PRESENTED.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed appeared and found a crash dump.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_NOT_SUBMITTED.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed was unloaded without submitting.

ABOUTCRASHES_OPENED_COUNT.description: Number of times about:crashes has been opened.

D3D9_COMPOSITING_FAILURE_ID.description: D3D9 compositor runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

D3D11_COMPOSITING_FAILURE_ID.description: D3D11 compositor runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

OPENGL_COMPOSITING_FAILURE_ID.description: OpenGL compositor runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

XHR_IN_WORKER.description: Number of the use of XHR in workers.

WEBVTT_TRACK_KINDS.description: Number of the use of the subtitles kind track. 0=Subtitles, 1=Captions, 2=Descriptions, 3=Chapters, 4=Metadata, 5=Undefined Error

WEBVTT_USED_VTT_CUES.description: Number of the use of the vtt cues.

CONTAINER_USED.description: Records a value each time a builtin container is opened. 1=personal 2=work 3=banking 4=shopping. Does not record usage of user-created containers.

UNIQUE_CONTAINERS_OPENED.description: Tracking the unique number of opened Containers.

TOTAL_CONTAINERS_OPENED.description: Tracking the total number of opened Containers.

FENNEC_SESSIONSTORE_DAMAGED_SESSION_FILE.description: When restoring tabs on startup, reading from sessionstore.js failed, even though the file exists and is not containing an explicitly empty window.

SHARED_WORKER_COUNT.description: Number of the use of SharedWorkers.

FENNEC_SESSIONSTORE_RESTORING_FROM_BACKU.description: When restoring tabs on startup, reading from sessionstore.js failed, but sessionstore.bak was read successfully.

NUMBER_OF_PROFILES.description: Number of named browser profiles for the current user, as reported by the profile service at startup.

WEB_PERMISSION_CLEARED.description: Number of revoke actions on permissions in the control center, keyed by permission id. Values represent the permission type that was revoked. (0=unknown, 1=permanently allowed, 2=permanently blocked, 3=temporarily allowed, 4=temporarily blocked)

JS_AOT_USAGE.description: Counts the number of asm.js vs WebAssembly modules instanciations, at the time modules are getting instanciated.

DOCUMENT_WITH_EXPANDED_PRINCIPAL.description: Number of documents encountered using an expanded principal.

CONTENT_PAINT_TIME.description: Time spent in the paint pipeline for content.

CONTENT_LARGE_PAINT_PHASE_WEIGHT.description: Percentage of time taken by phases in expensive content paints.

NARRATE_CONTENT_BY_LANGUAGE_2.description: Number of Narrate initialization attempts and successes broken up by content's language (ISO 639-1 code) (0 = initialization attempt, 1 = successfully initialized)

NARRATE_CONTENT_SPEAKTIME_MS.description: Time in MS that content is narrated in 10 second increments up to 5 minutes

HANDLE_UNLOAD_MS.description: The time spent handling unload event in milliseconds. It measures all documents and subframes separately. If there are multiple handlers for the unload event in a document, this will record a single value across all handlers in the document.

HANDLE_BEFOREUNLOAD_MS.description: The time spent handling beforeunload event in milliseconds. It measures all documents and subframes separately. If there are multiple handlers for the unload event in a document, this will record a single value across all handlers in the document.

TABCHILD_PAINT_TIME.description: Time spent painting the contents of a remote browser (ms).

TIME_TO_NON_BLANK_PAINT_MS.description: The time between navigation start and the first non-blank paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and non-blank paint. The non-blank paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.
